column4: i hope for the coming release Ubuntu does some thing about bad performance of firefox
current version of firefox is really crappy on my system
yep it's pretty crappy on mine as well,  that  unoffical Ubuntu version of Firefox
i am not running any thing out of the repository ...
Flash 10 64bit?
i think it uses npviewer.bin
Flash  is closed source, so  if you get issues with it, not much that can be done.  also Ubuntu's version of Firefox is unoffical
agreed, but i just wonder what happened to a sane browser from 8.4, it's unbearable in 8.10
go use another browser?  loads of good ones to choose from
or try the latest 3.1 beta from Mozilla?
tried that too ...no love..it keeps crashing

ok on 32bit  Flash  crashed a lot on 8.10.  ,but now I am on 9.04 alpha6, and well I had interesting crash last night to do with FLash and Firefox I thought, but it was differnet  this time round.  but anyway.   Flash 10  was there and working nicely today.   I had run 8.10  without FLash since last year
Firefox and Flash  =  Firefox crash, for some of us
every other app would be fine for me
you should try other browsers, loads of good ones to choose from
i always come crawling back to FF due to extensions :)
ok I have an idea
put Flash block on in  Firefox the add on yeah.  and then you can  run  Mozilla's  Flash plugin no problem in other browsers that  use it such as, Epiphany, Galeon, and Seamonkey
and then you can use Firefox for other stuff
basically make it so you can use that FLash, but  not in Firefox only other browsers
let me try
I think the add on is called Flash block or something like that.  you will find one I expect
then  do this :)   sudo apt-get install  epiphany-browser  galeon seamonkey
